content.text: Complete the frequency column in the table
Work out the percentage of people who cycle that are students
One day, Mahika records the number of teachers and students who cycle to school
Complete the table
One of the 120 students is chosen at random
Work out the probability that this student does not travel by bus to school
Mahika records how 120 students from Year 1 and Year 2 travel to school
Each student walks, cycles or travels by bus
* 48 students are in Year 1
* 77 students walk
* 5 students in Year 2 cycle
* 36 students travel by bus
* \(\frac{4}{9}\) of the students who travel by bus are in Year 1
Complete the table
Complete the pie chart
There have been 24 complaints about one of the buses
The complaints are:
· The bus is late
· The price is too high
· The bus is crowded
Calculate the interior angle of a regular pentagon
Work out the value of \(x\)
Give a geometrical reason for your answer
x =   .........  because
Work out the value of \(y\)
Give a geometrical reason for your answer
Find the ratio \(x:y\)
Give your answer in its simplest form
The diagram shows three congruent regular pentagons and a triangle
The diagram shows three quadrilaterals, \(A, B\) and \(C\), on a \(1\mathrm{cm}^2\) grid
Measure angle \(w\)
Describe fully the **single** transformation that maps
Work out the area of quadrilateral \(B\)
Give the units of your answer
Write down the mathematical name of the line
\(X, Y\) and \(Z\) lie on a circle, centre \(O\)
Measure the length of \(OX.\)
$YZ.$
Draw a net of the box on the \(1\mathrm{cm}^2\) grid
A container is a cube with volume \(1\mathrm{m}^3\)
Work out the maximum number of these boxes that can be packed into this container
A closed box, in the shape of a cuboid, has length \(5\mathrm{cm}\), width \(4\mathrm{cm}\) and height \(2\mathrm{cm}\)
Work out the cost in rupees of box \(B\)
.........  rupees
Calculate the mass of box \(C\)
Give your answer in kilograms
A shop sells three different sized boxes of rice
The boxes all have the same cost per kilogram
Change \(75\mathrm{cm}^3\) into litres
Give your answer in standard form
The spinner is spun once
Write down the probability that the spinner lands on
The diagram shows a fair 9-sided spinner
The numbers on the spinner are 2, 3, 5, 5, 5, 6, 6, 7 and 8
The spinner is spun 135 times
Work out the expected number of times the spinner lands on the number 6
1 mile = 1.609344 kilometres
Change 6 miles into **metres**
Give your answer correct to the nearest metre
The bearing of a boat from a harbour is \(322^{\circ}\)
Work out the bearing of the harbour from the boat
The boat is \(12\mathrm{km}\) from the harbour
At \(2.30\mathrm{pm}\) the boat starts to sail to the harbour
The speed of the boat is \(5\mathrm{km / h}\)
Work out the time the boat arrives at the harbour
Measure the bearing of \(M\) from \(S\)
Scale: 1 cm to 5 km
This scale drawing shows another map with Shakti's house, \(S\), marked on it
The scale of this map is \(1 \text{cm}\) represents \(5 \text{km}\)
Mark the position of Mairi's house, \(M\), on this map
The scale drawing shows the positions of Shakti's house, \(S\), and Mairi's house, \(M\), on a map. The scale is \(1 \text{cm}\) represents \(4 \text{km}\)
Scale: 1 cm to 4 km
Complete the table of values for \(y = x^{2} + 6x - 160.\)
On the grid, draw the graph of \(y = x^{2} + 6x - 160\) for \(-20 \leqslant x \leqslant 15.\)
Show that angle \(PRQ = 90^{\circ}\)
Calculate the area of the quadrilateral \(PQRS\)
Give your answer correct to 4 significant figures
The diagram shows Tarak's two triangular fields, \(PQR\) and \(PRS\)
Angle \(RPS = 90^{\circ}\) and angle \(PRS = 53^{\circ}\)
\(PQ = 174 \text{m}, QR = 120 \text{m}\) and \(PR = 126 \text{m}\)
The mass, \(m\) tonnes, of wheat grown in 2021 is 4.3 tonnes, correct to 1 decimal place
Complete this statement about the value of \(m\)
In 2020, 2.6 tonnes of barley is grown
In 2021, 3.25 tonnes of barley is grown
Show that the percentage increase in barley grown from 2020 to 2021 is \(25\%\)
In 2019, 2.4 tonnes of corn is grown
In 2020, \(20\%\) more corn is grown than in 2019
In 2021, \(20\%\) less corn is grown than in 2020
Calculate the amount of corn grown in 2021
.........  tonnes
Tarak has two fields
He grows wheat, barley and corn in his fields
